Its good

I enjoy this game. Each class has some sort of balance, the small community isn't toxic, and you don't die every 3 seconds. The majority of servers are empty, so you have plenty of places to practice, and there's no matchmaking, so you can end up in a server of newbies or TFC Veterans. Overall, it's a good game.

Team Fortress Classic
I beat meat
Pretty good

Just an average skilled player, but it's a great game. And if you're wondering if tf2 or tfc is better, there's really no answer, it's just depends which one you find more fun. Difficult learning curve, and confusing at first, but you'll get the hang of it eventually. Skill ceiling is also quite high for an old game, but can be rewarding. And there is no matchmaking, so you either will fight against the easiest opponents in your life, or literally a God at the game. Other community game modes include rocket jump maps, conc maps, bots vs humans (but bots have perfect aim, but weird ai, which makes it more fun), fun adventure maps, and etc. But not there are times where servers are empty, so just find the right time where there's decent amount of people (for me, it's around 10pm at Asia). (And if you're playing in Asia, good luck with having 200ms ping lmaooo)

I didn't even plan to buy this originally, but it was in a Black Friday bundle of all the Half-Life games I got a little while ago. It's not really my thing. That's not that it's a bad game, as I would recommend it overall, but it has a very steep learning curve, maybe even steeper than TF2's. There also aren't a lot of people playing and those that do are mostly veterans. I once got kicked from a server because I was trying to figure out the controls from the settings menu, as I had forgot some of them. 

I would recommend it if you enjoy old-school multiplayer FPS's like this, or if you're if you're a fan of TF2 who wants to see the game's roots, then get it on sale like I did.
its pretty fun to play but theres a huge learning curb

"Team Fortress Classic" ist ein Online Mehrspieler First-Person Shooter aus dem Jahre 1999.

Urspr√ºnglich als "Quake"-Mod im Jahre 1996 entwickelt, wurde Valve auf "Team Fortress" aufmerksam und portierte das Multiplayer-Game dann auf die hauseigene Half-Life-Engine. Als Valve "Team Fortress" zusammen mit "Half Life" im Bundle verkaufte, begann die Erfolgsgeschichte des Multiplayer Shooters. 

Dennoch wurde der erste Teil bei weitem nicht so erfolgreich wie sein Nachfolger "Team Fortress 2". Vieles gab es aber schon im ersten Teil. 

Der teambasierte Multiplayer-Shooter hatte ein schnelles und direktes Gameplay. Sage und schreibe zwischen neun Klassen konnte man w√§hlen. Ob Scout, Sniper, Pyro oder Spy, jede Klasse hatte ihre eigene Waffe und ihre eigenen Vor- und Nachteile.  Die Maps waren meist √ºberschaubar und auf schnelles und spa√üiges Geballer ausgelegt. Wirklich gut ausbalanciert ist der Shooter allerdings nicht. 

Grafik und Sound sind nat√ºrlicherweise kaum noch zeitgem√§√ü, waren aber zu ihrer Zeit, gerade f√ºr einen Online-Shooter, richtig gut. 

Heutzutage kann man das Spiel immer noch zocken, auch wenn die Spielerschaft √ºberschaubar geworden ist. Meist findet man zumindest einen halbvollen Server, auf dem sich - erwartungsgem√§√ü - viele Veteranen tummeln. Spa√ü macht der Klassiker immer noch, zumindest f√ºr Zwischendurch.

Imagine building a time machine just to go back when the servers are heavily populated.

Overall, it's somewhat janky and and buildings refuse to upgrade, but the novelty of having a remake to the original TF and seeing what the Team Fortress series was like before tf2 without messing around with PAKs was a very fun experience. Would recommend.
